DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study explore neurohumoral mechanism deferent frequency TEAS pretreatment .
DOC.brief_title: Neurohumoral Mechanism Deferent Frequency Transcutaneous Electrical Acupoint Stimulation ( TEAS )
DOC.detailed_description: Patients randomly assign three group , receive TEAS 30min anesthesia . The frequency high frequency group set 10/50HZ , low frequency group 2/10HZ , fake stimulation group attach electrodes without electric current . Acupoint selection bilateral Neiguan point ( PC6 ) . Venous blood collect 4ml immediately TEAS respectively . Heart rate variability monitor continuously 30min TEAS . The adverse event record .
DOC.criteria: Age 18yrs65yrs ASA 12 Scheduled elective operation general anesthesia BMI 1830kg/m2 Informed consent Contraindications TEAS Communication difficulty researcher Addicted alcohol , analgesic drug Cardiac insufficiency high blood pressure without control Hepatic renal dysfunction Participate clinical trial 3 month enrollment
